content.description: Actually a single line on the In Between Boulder just North of Little Debbie's Boulder (LDB).  An obvious seam up the wall facing LDB with the crux in the first ten feet of the seam, then a high (15'+) topout. Fun, especially for those who like finger cracks.
content.protection: A pad and spotter are in the bushes are recommended. If you are not solid at the grade, I don't recommend the line as it is a bit highball.

content.description: This problem is unnamed but is quite good.  Maybe someone out there knows what it's called??  It begins left of Sloper Chief with left hand on an obvioius hueco undercling.  Move straight up to crimps in the seam and fire for a friendly jug.  Cutting your feet loose and holding that swing can be cruxy.

Just right of Sloper Chief is this nice short line. Start standing on the large rock in the middle of the W face on slopers and small edges in a small dihedral.  Reach to a sloping rail / crack and fire for a large jug at the top, mantle and shout for joy.
content.protection: A large rock sits below the start to this problem. Pad(s) on the rock below and spotters are very nice to have.

content.description:
Begin Sloper Chief matched in the horzontal break at 5 feet above the ankle breaking boulder.  Move left two one of 3 options: A) left hand sidepull, B) lower left crimp slot, C) upper left crimp slot.  Move up with the right hand to the sloper with a good thumb catch.  Make your way to the sloping hueco and match in it.  Slap the lip and negotiate the delicate topout.

This is one of the harder V5s in the area and a great send if that is near your limit!
content.protection: Pad on the rock below the start and some spotters to catch you when you fly off the exit moves.

content.description:
Directions : just left of the undercling roof (Crapulator problem) and right of the boulder at the foot of the boulder.

A pure power problem involving some hard crimping, contact strength, and a wild dyno.  Start on any of the available crimps at head height and pull on heading straight up.  The finishing holds are huge (as opposed to all the other holds on this problem).  A Carter classic.
content.protection: Between 1 to 37 pads depending on your comfort level

content.description: Better than the name implies, climbs just left of the SW corner of Little Debbie's Boulder.  Grab a couple of solid underclings and over the roof to a large rail, be careful that your fingers don't get locked to badly in the underclings to let go. Watch the swing as you move fully onto the rail, then up and over. Short but fun.
content.protection: A few small rocks on the landing, a pad and spotters are nice to have.
